name: Sanders Li
bio: I am a self-taught developer, primarily working with Python, Node.js, and React. I graduated from USC with a BS in aerospace engineering and worked at Precision Castparts as a Dimensional Engineer, where I conducted statistical analysis and systems testing to improve manufacturing processes. I am passionate about reinforcement-based machine learning, statistical process control, interactive web-app development, and mechanical keyboards. I am interested in pursuing data analyst or software development roles.

experience.name: Precision Castparts Corp
experience.summary: Responsible for ensuring dimensional compliance of titanium casting products in multi-million-dollar product lines.
achievements: Orchestrated cost-reduction projects involving cross-functional teams of engineers and operations supervisors, reducing product lead time by 6%.
Oversaw experimental solutions to improve manufacturing processes, reducing dimensional inspection time by 85%.
Liaised between external customers and internal departments, interpreting customer specifications and quality standards to create technical instructions for operators.
Leveraged insights from data to effectively tackle key manufacturing problems and prove manufacturing capability, reducing surface defects on GE fan frame castings by an estimated 62%.

experience.name: Commedia Inc
experience.summary: Developed and implemented a domain evaluation system in Python for automatic content categorization
achievements: Integrated system with RocksDB database to ensure high-performance as system scales.
Implemented multithreading and Docker to provide a cross-platform, scalable solution.
Iteratively improved software features through design docs, git, code reviews, and rapid prototyping.
